relation: r300 free driver,Gallium 0.4 on RV350, 2.1 Mesa 7.9
pageTitle: Difference between revisions of "Contribute/Bugsquad/BugDays/KWinDay1" - KDE TechBase
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {18749=This bug day will take place on Sunday, October 10th 2010, but feel free to start early. The aim of this bug day is to get as many KWin-related bugs done as possible. Our target for triage is bugs listed in bugs.kde.org under the product KWin.}
textBeforeTable: You should be working with KDE SC 4 (preferably SVN trunk) for testing these bugs. There's a LiveCD which contains a snapshot of trunk which you can use here: http://susegallery.com/a/LpcWmF/bugsquad-live-cd. It's still somewhat untested. Ping Lemma on IRC if you're having trouble. Be sure to join #kde-bugs on irc.freenode.net, as this is where the bug-day will be coordinated. (You can even join now!) Some more information on how to mark bugs can be found on This page. Some bugs may not be reproducible on every installation of KDE. Thus we use a 4-eye principle, having at least 2 triagers look at the bugs before we make any changes on the bugs themselves. Some bugs will only be reprocudible on certain graphics hardware, so please always provide the graphics card and driver you are using. If a bug's description is somewhat unclear, try to provide a better step-by-step procedure on how to reproduce it. This will make it easier for developers to find and fix the bug. Check if bugs reported for KWin which are previously UNCONFIRMED are reproducible. Check for duplicates of newer bugs (>= version 2.4) Check if bugs reported for older versions of KWin (<= version
textAfterTable: IRC Nickname KDE version used for testing Graphics hardware FiNeX KDE 4.5.2, ArchLinux GeForce 9600 GT, nvidia 256.53,mesa 7.8.2 jtamate svn trunk r1184129 OpenSuse r300 free driver,Gallium 0.4 on RV350, 2.1 Mesa 7.9 Lemma svn trunk r1184315 NVIDIA GeForce 8600 GTS, 256.35   Tip If you're unsure about your graphics card or driver, you can use the glxinfo command in konsole to figure it out. Just look for the line "OpenGL version string". If you're still having trouble, just ask someone on #kde-bugs to help you.   Tip If desktop effects are not working with the free drivers ensure that the functionality checks in the advanced compositing settings tabs are disabled.
